first_reading.text:
[[Jb 7,1]]Job spoke, saying: "Is not man's life on earth a drudgery? Are not his days those of a hireling?
[[Jb 7,2]]He is a slave who longs for the shade, a hireling who waits for his wages.
[[Jb 7,3]]So I have been assigned months of misery, and troubled nights have been told off for me.
[[Jb 7,4]]If in bed I say, 'When shall I arise?' then the night drags on; I am filled with restlessness until the dawn.
[[Jb 7,6]]My days are swifter than a weaver's shuttle; they come to an end without hope.
[[Jb 7,7]]Remember that my life is like the wind; I shall not see happiness again."
first_reading.title: Book of Job

psalm.title: Psalms

gospel.text:
[[Mc 1,29]]On leaving the synagogue Jesus entered the house of Simon and Andrew with James and John.
[[Mc 1,30]]Simon's mother-in-law lay sick with a fever. They immediately told him about her.
[[Mc 1,31]]He approached, grasped her hand, and helped her up. Then the fever left her and she waited on them.
[[Mc 1,32]]When it was evening, after sunset, they brought to him all who were ill or possessed by demons.
[[Mc 1,33]]The whole town was gathered at the door.
[[Mc 1,34]]He cured many who were sick with various diseases, and he drove out many demons, not permitting them to speak because they knew him.
[[Mc 1,35]]Rising very early before dawn, he left and went off to a deserted place, where he prayed.
[[Mc 1,36]]Simon and those who were with him pursued him
[[Mc 1,37]]and on finding him said, "Everyone is looking for you."
[[Mc 1,38]]He told them, "Let us go on to the nearby villages that I may preach there also. For this purpose have I come."
[[Mc 1,39]]So he went into their synagogues, preaching and driving out demons throughout the whole of Galilee.
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Mark

second_reading.text:
[[1_Co 9,16]]Brothers and sisters : If I preach the Gospel, this is no reason for me to boast, for an obligation has been imposed on me, and woe to me if I do not preach it!
[[1_Co 9,17]]If I do so willingly, I have a recompense, but if unwillingly, then I have been entrusted with a stewardship.
[[1_Co 9,18]]What then is my recompense? That, when I preach, I offer the gospel free of charge so as not to make full use of my right in the gospel.
[[1_Co 9,19]]Although I am free in regard to all, I have made myself a slave to all so as to win over as many as possible.
[[1_Co 9,22]]To the weak I became weak, to win over the weak. I have become all things to all, to save at least some.
[[1_Co 9,23]]All this I do for the sake of the gospel, so that I too may have a share in it.
second_reading.title: First Letter to the Corinthians
